head.citation-title: Scene classification for color images based on quaternion and subspaces similarities
head.abstracts: In this paper, a scene classification of color images method is proposed based on the singular value decompositions of quaternion matrices and similarities with subspaces. Here we fuse the color information and the grey information together. Images are segmented to patches by a regular grid, and quaternion singular value decomposition (QSVD) is used to extract color features for each patch, and the grey features are extracted by Gabor filter and then using orientation histogram to descript the grey information. And then combine the color features and the orientation histogram together with the same weight to obtain the descriptor for each patch. All the patch descriptors are clustered and quantified to get visual words. Then the Kernel Principal Component Analysis (KPCA) is applied to the visual words to get the subspaces of the category. The descriptors of a test image then are projected to the subspaces of all categories to get the projection length to all categories of the test image. Finally, Support Vector Machine (SVM) with linear kernel function is used to get the scene classification performance. Experimented with three classification situations on OT8 dataset, and compared our method with the typical scene classification method pLSA, the result confirms the feasibility of our method.
